channel.title: LIBRCHAIN 区块链新闻雷达
channel.description: 每小时自动更新的区块链新闻、博客与 X 热点聚合

item.title: MrBeast Employee Fined, Suspended by Kalshi for Insider Trading on YouTube Videos
item.description: Kalshi revealed its first enforcement actions Wednesday, against a political candidate and an employee of YouTube star MrBeast.

item.title: Solana leads crypto recovery with 10% gain: Is $100 SOL price next?
item.description: Solana price eyes a potential rise toward the $110-$115 range, according to a confluence of bullish technical and onchain indicators.

item.title: Bitcoin climbs to $67,500, Circle leads crypto stocks higher, as bounce strengthens
item.description: Ether, solana and dogecoin are among the altcoins posting 10% or more advances.

item.title: Circle beats Q4 earnings estimates as USDC supply jumps 72%; shares surge 20%
item.description: The stablecoin issuer reported $770 million in revenue for the final 2025 quarter, beating forecasts as full-year sales rose 64% and USDC circulation topped $75 billion.

item.title: Bitcoin daily gains near 5% as analysis eyes bullish 'rotation' from gold
item.description: Bitcoin began an assault below the 200-week exponential moving average in fresh signs of upward BTC price momentum at the start of the US session.

item.title: Bitcoin treasury firm GD Culture set to sell BTC holdings to fund share buybacks
item.description: The company's stock has lost about two-thirds of its value since peaking last year, nearly in step with bitcoin's record price above $126,000.

item.title: Democrat Senator Launches $1.7B Iran Sanctions Probe Into Binance
item.description: Senator Richard Blumenthal has launched an inquiry into alleged Iran-linked crypto transfers as Binance pushes back against the claims.

item.title: Circle Stock Jumps Double Digits as It Reports 72% Rise in USDC Circulation
item.description: Circle’s USDC grew 72% in Q4 as transaction volume soared and CRCL stock popped on bullish AI and payments commentary.

item.title: XRP jumps 6% as exchange data points to institutional accumulation
item.description: Break above $1.37 draws strong spot demand, with ETF inflows and retail buying suggesting positioning shift.

item.title: Endowments eye crypto allocations amid tougher return outlook for traditional investments
item.description: Lower expected gains from traditional assets have prompted some funds to test bitcoin and ether exposure to diversify portfolios.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Strategy yield wrapper lands in Europe as 21Shares lists STRC ETP
item.description: 21Shares debuts the Strategy Yield ETP on Euronext Amsterdam on Thursday, giving Europe regulated access to Strategy’s preferred stock, which is heavily backed by Bitcoin.

item.title: CoinDesk 20 performance update: Polkadot (DOT) surges 17.2% as all assets rise
item.description: Avalanche (AVAX), up 12.9% from Tuesday, was also among the top performers.

item.title: The chief of the SEC is headlining an event sponsored by a crypto firm at war with it
item.description: SEC Chairman Paul Atkins is a marquee speaker at a policy summit backed by Unicoin, whose CEO says the agency chief is being duped by his staff.

item.title: Revolut among 4 companies chosen to test stablecoins in UK sandbox
item.description: The UK Financial Conduct Authority selected Monee, ReStabilise, Revolut and VVTX to test stablecoin issuance and payments in its regulatory sandbox beginning in Q1 2026.

item.title: Morning Minute: Stablecoins Are Eating Everything
item.description: Huge headlines from Stripe and Meta have stablecoins squarely back in the forefront of the crypto discussion.

item.title: South Korea moves to require crypto, stock influencers to disclose holdings: Report
item.description: A proposed law would require online investment influencers to reveal their holdings and paid promotions, with penalties potentially comparable to market manipulation violations.

item.title: FG Nexus sells another $14M in Ether as losses mount on treasury bet
item.description: FG Nexus sold another $14 million in Ether from its corporate treasury, bringing its losses to over $80 million as Ether-focused balance sheets come under mounting market pressure.

item.title: These bitcoin-linked stocks are doing better than BTC
item.description: Your day-ahead look for Feb. 25, 2026

item.title: Polkadot, Solana Lead Altcoin Surge Ahead of Nvidia Earnings Call
item.description: Crypto markets climb 3% as traders position for Nvidia's earnings, which analysts say now overshadow the SOTU as the key catalyst.

item.title: Circle Q4 earnings beat estimates as USDC issuance grows, shares surge
item.description: The issuer of the USDC stablecoin posted EPS of 43 cents for the fourth quarter, beating the consensus estimate of 16 cents.

item.title: Aave governance dispute escalates as ACI and Aave Labs publish dueling reports
item.description: Competing reports outline contrasting views on protocol revenue, development and funding accountability.

item.title: U.S. Senator opens probe on Binance over alleged $1.7 billion flow to Iranian entities
item.description: Richard Blumenthal sent Binance co-chief Richard Teng a letter asking him for records about the exchange’s dealings with Iran-linked entities and the alleged dismissal of its investigators.

item.title: Crypto rebounds from oversold levels, altcoin season indicator revisits January high
item.description: Bitcoin rose as much as 3.7% overnight before paring gains, while altcoins outperformed and the altcoin season indicator hit its highest level since January.

item.title: One of the longest mining capitulations nears end, signaling potential BTC price bottom
item.description: Hash Ribbon recovery and sub production pricing suggest the worst of the bitcoin drawdown may have passed.

item.title: Judge Dismisses xAI Trade Secrets Lawsuit Against OpenAI, Allows Refiling
item.description: A federal judge has ruled that xAI's complaint failed to connect OpenAI to any alleged theft by former employees.

item.title: Bitcoin price climbs 3% as gold divergence signals ‘significant upside’
item.description: Bitcoin’s failure to replicate gains in gold and stocks over the last six months may result in a delayed rally as BTC price returns to $65,000.

item.title: Strategy becomes most heavily shorted U.S. stock – but don't assume pure bearishness
item.description: Short interest in MSTR equals 14% of market cap, yet much of the positioning may reflect basis trades rather than outright bets on a continued decline.

item.title: US senator launches probe into Binance over Iran, Russia sanctions claims
item.description: Binance rejected the allegations, saying it flags suspicious activity, enforces strict compliance procedures and does not permit Iranian users on the platform.

item.title: Bitcoin bounces to $66K as rumors swirl over Jane Street selling algorithm
item.description: Bitcoin traders had mixed opinions over what caused a BTC price rebound past $66,000 as attention focused on Jane Street selling pressure.

item.title: Anchorage buys STRC as Wall Street shorts mount against Saylor’s Bitcoin proxy
item.description: Strategy has become the most-shorted large-cap US stock as hedge funds ramp up bearish bets, according to data from Goldman Sachs.

item.title: US seizes $61M in USDT linked to ‘pig butchering’ crypto fraud scheme
item.description: The $61 million USDT seizure in North Carolina shows how US authorities can trace and freeze stablecoin flows tied to pig butchering scams, as AI‑driven impersonation schemes surge.

item.title: Bitcoin ETFs post $258M inflows as institutional Q4 selling hits 25,000 BTC
item.description: US spot Bitcoin ETF flows turned green on Tuesday, with Fidelity and BlackRock leading gains despite persistent weak market sentiment.

item.title: Leading stablecoin Tether shrinks again as market cap looks set for second straight monthly drop
item.description: Growth of tether and other top stablecoins has stalled, posing risk to the broader crypto market.

item.title: Hong Kong to link new digital bond platform with regional tokenization hubs
item.description: Hong Kong will build a digital asset platform for tokenized bond issuance and settlement, while moving ahead with stablecoin licensing and CARF.

item.title: Vitalik Buterin sold 17,000 ETH this month as ether fell 37%
item.description: The Ethereum co-founder's tracked wallets dropped from 241,000 ETH to 224,000 ETH in February, with sales routed through CoW Protocol in small batches to limit market impact.

item.title: Crypto firm with U.S. bank charter holds bitcoin holder Strategy's preferred stock
item.description: Anchorage Digital, the first federally chartered U.S. crypto bank, has added perpetual preferred stock in bitcoin treasury firm Strategy to its balance sheet.

item.title: Dogecoin jumps 5% as breakout flips resistance into support
item.description: The token is consolidating around $0.0940–$0.0945 with higher lows, signaling constructive momentum after the breakout.

item.title: Bitcoin adoption is booming, even if its price isn’t: River
item.description: River reports that Bitcoin adoption surged in 2025, cementing it as a mature asset class, even as its price has halved since hitting a peak in October.

item.title: Coinbase CEO Pushes Back on UK Stablecoin Caps as Token Profits Surge
item.description: The proposal would cap stablecoin holdings and curb yields, a move critics say could push liquidity overseas as stablecoins become a core revenue stream.

item.title: South Korean man indicted in alleged pesticide poisoning tied to crypto losses
item.description: South Korean prosecutors reportedly accused a man of poisoning a business partner with pesticide in a dispute over losses due to crypto trading.

item.title: Bitcoin bounces above $65,000 as dollar weakens and bullish hopes build
item.description: A broad uptick across tokens arrived alongside a softer greenback and a rally in Asian equities, though analysts remain split on whether the Feb. 5 lows will hold.

item.title: Bitcoin Ticks Higher as Markets Weigh Trump Address, Broader Risk Sentiment
item.description: Bitcoin remains sensitive to broader risk sentiment, with traders positioning ahead of Nvidia’s earnings and a rebound in global stocks.

item.title: Bitcoin captures $65K after US stocks rebound from AI sell-off: Will it hold?
item.description: Bitcoin rallied above $66,000 following a positive close from US stock markets, putting Monday’s AI and tech-stock driven sell-off to rest. Will $60,000 remain the BTC bottom?

item.title: Payoneer joins rush of fintechs bidding for US bank charters
item.description: Coinbase, World Liberty Financial and Laser Digital are also in line for a banking charter in the US, after Crypto.com received conditional approval for a charter on Monday.

item.title: Stripe in Early Talks on Potential PayPal Deal: Bloomberg
item.description: The deal could combine two major payments firms already expanding into stablecoin and crypto infrastructure.

item.title: Treasury Sanctions Russian ‘Exploit’ Broker Over Stolen US Cyber Tools
item.description: It marks the first use of the Protecting American Intellectual Property Act, targeting a firm accused of brokering stolen U.S. cyber tools.

item.title: Coinbase, Kraken and Binance Push Deeper Into Tokenization as Capital Shifts
item.description: Tokenized real-world assets have continued to expand despite a broader market slide, with assets distributed on-chain up nearly 300% year over year.

item.title: Bitcoin Depot Will Require ID for 'Every Transaction' at ATMs Amid Growing Pressure
item.description: Bitcoin Depot will begin verifying customers’ identities each time they use its ATMs, voluntarily refining its compliance procedures.

item.title: Crypto wallets for AI agents are creating a new legal frontier, says Electric Capital
item.description: As AI agents grow more autonomous, developers are already giving them crypto wallets, allowing software to hold assets, pay for services, trade tokens and even hire other agents. The technical pieces are falling into place. The legal ones …

item.title: Payments giant Stripe reportedly mulling PayPal acquisition. Here is what it means for crypto
item.description: Bloomberg reported that Stripe — which has growing stablecoin and blockchain ambitions — is exploring a deal for the embattled fintech.

item.title: OpenAI Says Benchmark Used to Measure AI Coding Skill Is 'Contaminated'—Here's Why
item.description: OpenAI wants to retire the leading AI coding benchmark—and the reasons reveal a deeper problem with how the whole industry measures itself.

item.title: Bitwise's Hunter Horsley says AI Is ‘unstoppable freight train’ for crypto, while Haun’s Monica urges caution
item.description: As artificial intelligence races ahead, some crypto executives believe it could become the force that finally pushes blockchain infrastructure into widespread use. Others aren’t convinced the leap is so straightforward.

item.title: 'Stablecoin Summer': Stripe Makes Tender Offer at $159 Billion Valuation
item.description: Payments giant Stripe made a tender offer valuing the firm at $159 billion as payments and stablecoin volumes rise.

item.title: After Donating $35 Million to Trump PAC, Crypto.com Scores Wins From Regulators
item.description: Weeks after giving another $5 million to a pro-Trump PAC, the exchange received lawsuit aid from the CFTC and a bank charter from the Treasury Department.

item.title: South Korean Man Faces Murder Charge Over Bitcoin Bet Gone Bad
item.description: Prosecutors in Seoul say a man poisoned his business partner after the colleague mismanaged his Bitcoin investments.

item.title: Solo Bitcoin Miner Nabs $200K After Renting $75 Worth of Hash Power
item.description: Despite incredibly long odds, someone scored a $200K BTC block reward after spending just $75 to rent Bitcoin mining power.

item.title: WisdomTree Gets SEC Nod to Enable Instant Settlement for Tokenized Money Market Fund
item.description: WisdomTree is enabling instant settlement for its tokenized money market fund, indicating its product won't be limited by Wall Street’s pace.

item.title: Trump’s White House Has One View of Crypto Legislation. His Family’s Crypto Company Has Another
item.description: World Liberty Financial is backing Coinbase on the crypto market structure bill debate, even as the White House criticizes the company.

item.title: Ethereum Foundation Starts Staking Treasury Amid Vitalik Buterin's ETH Sales
item.description: The Ethereum Foundation began staking ETH as part of new treasury operations amid a string of sales from co-founder Vitalik Buterin.
